verses.text: O that my load of sin were gone! O that I could at last submit At Jesus' feet to lay it downâ€” To lay my all at Jesus' feet!
Rest for my soul I long to find; Saviour of all, if mine thou art, Give me thy meek and lowly mind, And stamp thine image on my heart.
Break off the yoke of inbred sin, And fully set my spirit free; I cannot rest till pure within, Till I am wholly lost in thee.
Fain would I learn of thee, my God; Thy fight and easy burden prove, The cross, all stained with hallowed blood, The labour of thy dying love.
I would, but thou must give the power; My heart from every sin release; Bring near, bring near the joyful hour, And fill me with thy perfect peace.
